body: @chavdar can you review?
Just one comment, LGTM otherwise.
LGTM.
Pleas fix the FindBugs warnings.

@ydai1124 After merging it from master branch, there's a exception I am getting after successfully completed the task and when it's writing task state into FileSystem, it's complaining the FileSystem is already closed. Have you seen this problem? (I am not sure if my change brought this problem as my change didn't touch this part and JDBC writer is showing same failure as well.)

@jinhyukchang Which test you saw these failures? It looks like the statestore fs gets closed before it should. I don't recall any change related to it.
LGTM
@ydai1124 I just ran integration test case from HDFS(AVRO) --> Salesforce and HDFS(AVRO) -> MySQL which were working before merging. (JOB type: MR)
LGTM

@ydai1124 Found the root cause. There was a recent commit (8/14) that closes FileSystem.
https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/commit/342d20b1dbe9f1f83fe53c6ee0299c04bb9d71b8#diff-f6b4e6837a023e738b2538aa22b84e8dR170

When I commented close part in HadoopFsHelper, it's completing task without exception. Since it's a separate problem, I will create an issue on this.

Please let me know if there's anything more to be done to be merged.

When I use git rebase -i, it brings almost hundred commits and brings conflicts.
@jinhyukchang That's fine. I am gonna merge this PR.
Trivial, merging

Is it possible to have the TeradataWriter (PR #1181) too in this release?
I'm also addressing the comments made for the OracleExtractor PR (#1074) and will fix the issues based on  @jinhyukchang's and my implementation.

Hi @lbendig,
Does TeradataWriter work with TYPE=FASTLOAD ?

@lbendig 
Left some comments please take a look.

@jinhyukchang  I haven't added the fastload option because due to some its limitations, like:
- it can only insert to an empty table
- the parallell writes shouldn't exceed the number of the AMPs
- there are restrictions on then lenght of naming the columns/tables
- not all the jdbc types are supported, like clobs, blobs

but later I think it would be good to have it, I'll do some tests.
@pcadabam Thanks for the comments. I made my comments inline.

@ydai1124: Would like to get this in before 0.8.0 release
@ibuenros: review?

Synced with @shirshanka and added FileSystem.close() on MRJobLauncher. Passed integration test.

@shirshanka, @ibuenros , Could you take a look?

Trivial doc change. Merging.
LGTM
LGTM
@lbendig Yes, I wondered if fastload requires any additional code change or not -- as long as conditions meet. Thanks!

There are some test failures in this PR. Historically, we've had issues with tests using an embedded Kafka server, especially around timing (Travis nodes are very slow in general).
Is there any way we can avoid using an embedded Kafka server? In metrics we get around this by using a `KafkaPusher` and a `MockKafkaPusher`. There is also a `HighLevelConsumer` and a `MockHighLevelConsumer` for manually pushing messages into something that looks like a Kafka high level consumer.
LGTM
Small comment. LGTM
LGTM other than that one comment

The failures seem related to gobblin-runtime:test not gobblin-kafka:test. 

I noticed KafkaPusherTest uses an EmbeddedKafkaServer, so was using that as reference.

The idea is `KafkaPusherTest` is the only test with an embedded kafka, everything else uses a pusher. That way, worst case scenario, if we trust the pusher, we can disable that test in Travis or other unreliable systems.
LGTM
@shirshanka Will you be able to have a doc for Kafka writer? So I can reference it in the release.

@ibuenros : Addressed most of the review comments.
